main_definition: When referring to a status or condition, 'checked' means examined or verified by someone or something. In the context of an idiom, it often relates to confirming information or ensuring accuracy.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To verify or confirm through inspection
meanings_and_examples.example: The flight attendant checked if all passengers had fastened their seatbelts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having undergone an examination or review
meanings_and_examples.example: My doctor checked my blood pressure and cholesterol levels during the appointment.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Acknowledging the accuracy of a statement or information
meanings_and_examples.example: She asked to see her bank statements, just to check if there were any unauthorized transactions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To put under supervision or observation
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher checked on the students while they worked independently.
